column4: did u know dell is putting ubuntu and some of their laptops and desktops?
good I hope more people hear about it and jump on ubuntu..  much better os
I would like to be able to play more games on ubuntu tho beside dos box
I tried oblivion under wine but not so hot
think i'll try gta san andreas
what's the best torrent client for ubuntu?
what kind of experiene do you want?
do you want a minimalistic, highly configurable, command-line client
it uses way too many resources in my experience, java is ew...
and az devs don't really agree with ubuntu devs
rtorrent is a nice cli client :D
of course. but vlc is bleh
i'd recommend trying mplayer first. if you don't like the cli, try one of the many guis
vlc uses its own decoders, so i don't recommend it
